intro: Chadsia flammea subsp. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered flame chadsia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
